page.title: 03 Life in Slipton
page.content: Slipton is a very quiet village. Few people are to be seen around the village. There are no shops and only one pub called the 'Samuel Pepys' at the road junction in the centre of the village. It is a very busy pub with three bars and it serves meals and snacks. There are two restaurants which will seat 50 people altogether. About ten people work in the pub, three full time, the remainder being catering students from Tresham College in Corby. There are four double bedrooms for long stay residents. It is a free houses serving seven different kinds of beer.
